title: Image Generation Model Types Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of AI image generation models and their use cases.

questions.question: Which AI image model is known for being open-source and highly customizable?
questions.explanation: Stable Diffusion is open-source and allows for extensive customization through LoRAs, VAEs, and community models.

questions.question: Gemini 2.5 Flash can edit existing images, not just generate new ones.
questions.explanation: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana) supports advanced image editing capabilities including background removal, pose alteration, and image fusion.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of DALL-E 3 over earlier models?

options.text: Better understanding of complex prompts and natural language

questions.explanation: DALL-E 3 excels at understanding nuanced prompts and following detailed instructions better than previous versions.

questions.question: Which model would be best for creating consistent character designs across multiple images?
questions.explanation: LoRAs (Low-Rank Adaptations) allow you to train Stable Diffusion on specific characters or styles for consistency.

questions.question: Midjourney can be run locally on your own computer.
questions.explanation: Midjourney is a cloud-based service accessed through Discord or their web interface. It cannot be run locally.

questions.question: What does 'diffusion' refer to in Stable Diffusion?

options.text: The speed at which images are generated
The process of adding noise to images during training and removing it during generation
How the model shares data across servers
The distribution method for the software

questions.explanation: Diffusion models work by learning to reverse a noise-adding process, gradually 'denoising' random pixels into coherent images.

questions.question: Which use case is BEST suited for AI image generation?

options.text: Creating identical copies of existing photos
Concept art and mood boards for creative projects

questions.explanation: AI image generation excels at creative exploration, concept visualization, and rapid prototyping of visual ideas.

questions.question: Google's Imagen is available as an open-source model for anyone to download and use locally.
questions.explanation: Imagen is a proprietary Google model. While it's accessible through Google Cloud APIs, it's not open-source like Stable Diffusion.
